alert.note: Alert for Central and West Carbon; North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued October 09 at 2:19PM MDT until October 10 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS IN EFFECT FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL WYOMING FROM NOON TO 6PM TUESDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT TUESDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 422 AND 427... The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect Tuesday afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 422.Fire weather zone 427. * WIND...Southwest 15 to 20 MPH with gusts up to 30 MPH. * HUMIDITY...As low as 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Central and West Carbon; North Snowy Range Foothills
